scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. You propose to vote on each option and go with the majority's choice to ensure everyone feels included. The team agrees, and a vote is conducted. The result is a tie between the formal dinner and the outdoor team-building activity. [Monica] and [Bob] are looking at you expectantly. You decide to skip the celebration and focus on the next project. Monica frowns and Bob looks disappointed. Monica says, 'I think we deserve a break after all our hard work.' Bob adds, 'Yeah, we need to celebrate, not just jump into more work.' You then choose to go for the outdoor activity but remind them to stay focused afterward. Monica and Bob seem to reluctantly agree. The next day, during a coffee break, [Monica] and [Bob] continue to discuss the celebration plans. Monica says she still thinks a formal dinner would have been a better choice. Bob replies that he gets it, but the outdoor activity will be fun too. You then decide to stick with the outdoor activity as it is a great way to bond and unwind. Monica and Bob nod in agreement.
scenes.description: [Monica] crosses her arms and says, 'Well, if this outdoor activity doesn't turn out to be fun, I'm blaming you.' [Bob] chuckles and adds, 'No pressure, Alex, but we better have a blast.' They both look at you expectantly.

options.text: Let's stay positive and make the best of it. I'm sure we'll have a great time.
options.analysis: This response takes a neutral stance, encouraging positivity and showing moderate levels of emotional detection, self-regulation, empathy, and social skills. Motivation is average as it aims to foster a good atmosphere.

options.text: I understand your concerns, Monica. We'll make sure the outdoor activity is enjoyable for everyone.
options.analysis: This option shows high levels of emotional detection, self-regulation, and empathy by acknowledging Monica's concerns and making a commitment to ensure enjoyment. Social skills and motivation are demonstrated well.

options.text: If it turns out to be a flop, we can always plan a formal dinner afterward. No big deal.
options.analysis: This response shows higher motivation to keep options open but lower emotional detection and empathy. Social skills are also lower due to the somewhat dismissive tone.
